sanskrit_verse:
कृष्तजानामोषधीनां जातानां च स्वयं वने ।
वृथालम्भेऽनुगच्छेद्गां दिनमेकं पयोव्रतः ॥ ११.१४४॥
transliteration:
kṛṣṭajānāmoṣadhīnāṁ jātānāṁ ca svayaṁ vane |
vṛthālambe 'nugacched gāṁ dinamekaṁ payovrataḥ || 11.144||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has caused loss or destruction of cultivated crops, medicinal plants, or naturally grown vegetation in the forest shall follow the path of milk-vow (payovrata) for one day while accompanying a cow, as a conscious act of restoration.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with natural dharmic order
Causation is determined through direct energetic impact on living systems
Capacity-based responsibility arises from intentional interference with sustenance ecosystems
Restoration logic requires reconnection with life-giving sources
Consciousness alignment occurs through embodied acts of ecological reverence
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent causes measurable damage to cultivated flora OR wild vegetation THEN initiate one-day payovrata protocol
IF violation involves ecological disruption THEN assign supervised cow-following completion process
IF intent level >= moderate THEN extend observation period post-completion for integrity verification
IF systemic pattern detected THEN escalate to community dharma council for capacity restoration intervention
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes threshold liability based on verifiable causation within biospheric systems. The court must assess whether the action disrupted pranic flow within local ecology and determine appropriate restorative engagement that reconnects the offender with foundational life-support structures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Through pramāṇa-based analysis, the sequential manifestation of harm is traced from intention to environmental effect. Responsibility is proportionally assigned according to the degree of disruption caused. The prescribed corrective measure aligns with non-punitive reality by transforming error into conscious service without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate one-day supervised cow-following process under qualified guide
Implement daily pre-dawn milk offering ritual during vrata period
Assign reflective documentation task on ecological interdependence
Complete group sharing circle upon conclusion to restore communal harmony
final_declaration: By the authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma, this law stands executed. Harm is transformed through conscious alignment. Justice flows as restoration. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns supreme.
